patterns: I want to know about EASTC
Can you give me information about EASTC?
i need to know about EASTC
what do you know about EASTC
responses: The Eastern Africa Statistical Training Centre (EASTC) was established in 1961 to address the shortage of statisticians in Africa. Initially located in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, the Centre began operations in 1965, offering middle and later intermediate level training. It became a regional institution serving multiple African countries. EASTC evolved into a higher learning institution in 2012, offering degrees in Official Statistics, and later introduced graduate programs, including a Master's Degree in Official Statistics in 2014 and a Master's Degree in Agricultural Statistics in 2015. EASTC is owned by 19 countries and continues to serve Anglophone Africa.

The Eastern Africa Statistical Training Centre (EASTC) is a Government Higher Learning institution under the Ministry of Finance and Planning. It is also a regional institution, which trains Official Statistics across the Eastern Africa Region currently serving 19 member countries.

patterns: does the college have library facility
Is the library open on weekends?
responses: The library is the heart of the EASTC and it is an integral part of the Eastern Africa Statistical Training Centre's mission which revolves around teaching, studying, research, and consultancy. Opening hours: Weekdays 08:00 AM - 10:00 PM, Weekends: Saturday 08:00 AM - 05:00 PM and Sunday 09:00 AM - 01:00 PM, Public holidays: Closed. For more information about Centre's library such as Library guidelines and E-resource access  [please click here](https://www.eastc.ac.tz/index.php?r=site%2Flibrary2)

patterns: What are the entry requirements for the Masters of Official Statistics?
How can I apply for the Masters of Official Statistics?
What qualifications do I need for the Masters of Official Statistics?
Can you tell me the admission criteria for the Masters of Official Statistics?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Masters of Official Statistics?
What do I need to join the Masters of Official Statistics program?
responses: To join our Masters of Official Statistics program, you'll need a Bachelor's Degree in fields such as Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Finance, Accounts, Commerce, IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Agriculture, or any other science and business-related field with a strong background in mathematics. Additionally, you should have a minimum GPA of 2.7 from a recognized higher learning institution.

patterns: What are the entry requirements for the Masters of Science in Agricultural Statistics?
How can I apply for the Masters of Science in Agricultural Statistics?
What qualifications do I need for the Masters of Science in Agricultural Statistics?
Can you tell me the admission criteria for the Masters of Science in Agricultural Statistics?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Masters of Science in Agricultural Statistics?
What do I need to join the Masters of Science in Agricultural Statistics program?
responses: To join our Masters of Science in Agricultural Statistics program, you'll need a Bachelor's Degree in fields such as Statistics, Official Statistics, Agricultural Statistics and Economics, Agribusiness, Economics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Finance, Accounts, Commerce, IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Agriculture, or any other science and business-related field with a strong background in mathematics. Additionally, you should have a minimum GPA of 2.7 from a recognized higher learning institution.

patterns: What are the entry requirements for the Bachelor of Official Statistics?
How can I apply for the Bachelor of Official Statistics?
What qualifications do I need for the Bachelor of Official Statistics?
Can you tell me the admission criteria for the Bachelor of Official Statistics?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Bachelor of Official Statistics?
What do I need to join the Bachelor of Official Statistics program?
responses:
To join our Bachelor of Official Statistics program, you'll need two principal passes in subjects such as Advanced Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Accountancy, Agriculture, Geography, Economics, Computers, or Commerce. If one of your principal passes is not in Advanced Mathematics, you'll need a Subsidiary pass in Basic Applied Mathematics or a minimum of 'D' grade in Mathematics at O-Level. Alternatively, a Foundation Programme of the OUT with a minimum GPA of 3.0 is also acceptable.

For holders of Ordinary Diploma or equivalent qualifications, a Diploma or Full Technician Certificate (FTC) in relevant fields such as Statistics, Computing and Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Technology, Accounting, Transport Finance, Taxation, Banking and Finance, Custom and Tax Administration, Business Information Technology, Procurement, Insurance and Risk Management, Business Management, Business Administration, Development Planning, Community Development, Engineering, Education, Science and Technology, Health-related programs, or Economics with an average of 'B' or a minimum GPA of 3.0 is required.

For holders of Ordinary Diploma or equivalent qualifications, a Diploma or Full Technician Certificate (FTC) in relevant fields such as Statistics, Computing and Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Technology, Accounting, Transport Finance, Taxation, Banking and Finance, Custom and Tax Administration, Business Information Technology, Procurement, Insurance and Risk Management, Business Management, Business Administration, Development Planning, Community Development, Engineering, Education, Science and Technology, Health-related programs, or Economics with an average of ‘B’ or a minimum GPA of 3.0 is required.

patterns: What are the entry requirements for the Diploma in Statistics (NTA Level 5)?
How can I apply for the Diploma in Statistics (NTA Level 5)?
What qualifications do I need for the Diploma in Statistics (NTA Level 5)?
Can you tell me the admission criteria for the Diploma in Statistics (NTA Level 5)?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Diploma in Statistics (NTA Level 5)?
What do I need to join the Diploma in Statistics (NTA Level 5) program?
responses:
To join our Diploma in Statistics (NTA Level 5) program, you'll need an Advanced Level Certificate in Secondary Education (ACSEE) with a minimum of E and S in subjects such as Advanced Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Geography, Accounts, Economics, Commerce, or Agriculture. If one of the passes is not in Advanced Mathematics or Subsidiary in BAM, you'll need a pass in O' Level Basic Mathematics.

Alternatively, you can join with a Certificate (NTA 4) in Statistics, Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, ICT, or its equivalent as established by NACTE or NECTA based on Tanzania's education system.

patterns: What are the entry requirements for the Diploma in Information Technology?
How can I apply for the Diploma in Information Technology?
What qualifications do I need for the Diploma in Information Technology?
Can you tell me the admission criteria for the Diploma in Information Technology?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Diploma in Information Technology?
What do I need to join the Diploma in Information Technology program?
responses:
To join our Diploma in Information Technology program, you'll need an Advanced Level Certificate in Secondary Education (ACSEE) with any E (Principal) and S (Subsidiary) in non-religious subjects.

Alternatively, you can join with a Certificate (NTA 4) in Business Information Technology, Information Technology with Accounting, Information Technology, Computer Science, ICT, Statistics, or any other ICT-related programs.

patterns: What are the entry requirements for the Basic Technician Certificate in Statistics (NTA Level 4)?
How can I apply for the Basic Technician Certificate in Statistics (NTA Level 4)?
What qualifications do I need for the Basic Technician Certificate in Statistics (NTA Level 4)?
Can you tell me the admission criteria for the Basic Technician Certificate in Statistics (NTA Level 4)?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Basic Technician Certificate in Statistics (NTA Level 4)?
What do I need to join the Basic Technician Certificate in Statistics (NTA Level 4) program?
responses:
To join our Basic Technician Certificate in Statistics (NTA Level 4) program, you'll need an Ordinary Level Secondary Certificate with at least four passes including Mathematics and English or its equivalent as established by NECTA based on Tanzania's education system.

Alternatively, you can join with an Ordinary Level Secondary Certificate and NVA 3 in a relevant field from a recognized VETA institution.

content: To apply for admission at EASTC, please follow these steps:
Read the entry qualifications for the program you are interested in
Create an account via [this link](https://olap.eastc.ac.tz/site/login) by clicking 'Register' on our website
After registration, log in using the username and password you provided during account creation
Complete the registration process by filling in your personal details, such as date of birth and region.
Provide next of kin information
Fill in your education background.
Select your program choice
Preview your application.
Click 'Submit' to complete your application

patterns: How can I appeal my exam results?
What is the process for appealing exam results?
Can you explain the steps to appeal?
When can I submit an appeal?
How do I file an appeal for my exam results?
responses:
If you have any complaints about your examination results, please follow these steps:

1. Fill in the appeal form.
2. Attach any relevant evidence to support your appeal.
3. Pay the requisite fee of TZS 100,000/=
4. Submit the completed appeal form and attached evidence to the Examination Office.
5. Ensure your appeal is submitted within seven (07) days from the date of release of provisional examination results.

patterns: What are the conditions for readmission?
How can I be readmitted to studies?
What are the requirements for readmission to studies?
Can you tell me the criteria for readmission?
What do I need to do to be readmitted?
How can I get readmitted to EASTC?
responses: If you were discontinued from a program on academic grounds (other than exam irregularity), you may be readmitted at any time if you meet the entry requirements. If you postponed studies for fee-related reasons, you must pay all unpaid fees before being readmitted. Discontinued students on academic grounds can reapply after one academic year, provided they have acquired additional qualifications or evidence of extra-mural studies. For health-related postponements, readmission requires a medical recommendation and approval by the Centre.
I am EASTC's virtual assistant, here to help you with information about the Eastern Africa Statistical Training Center. How can I assist you today?

patterns: tell me about the history of EASTC
responses: The Eastern Africa Statistical Training Centre (EASTC) was established in 1961 to address the shortage of statisticians in Africa. It began operations in 1965 in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, initially offering Certificate courses and later upgrading to Diploma courses. The center has evolved to offer degree programs and continues to serve multiple countries in Eastern and Southern Africa.

EASTC was regionalized in 1980, serving multiple countries in Eastern and Southern Africa. The center continues to be a regional statistical institution serving Anglophone Africa, with participation from countries like Botswana, Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and more.

content: Hostels are available for all students wishing to reside inside EASTC Campus and are paid in Full per academic year.
Students wishing to reside at EASTC Hostels should have first paid the annual Administrative costs of 185,000 before application and payment of Hostels is done.

After payment of the 185,000 administrative Costs, students should report to the EASTC Admission office for obtaining of Registration Number and thereafter submit the Bank slips to the EASTC Accounts Office in order to get the EASTC Receipt.

After payment of administrative costs, students may login into their individual students information system accounts (SIS) through the link www.sis2.eastc.ac.tz to proceed with application and payment for Hostels.
Please note that No student will be able to apply for Hostels without payment of the administrative costs.
accomodation cost per year
hostel A & B (4 per room) - Tsh 440,000/=
hostel A & B (2 per room) - Tsh 740,000/=
hostel 1 (2 per room) - Tsh 1,200,000/=
hostel 2 & 3 (4 per room) - Tsh 540,000/=

responses: to know more about examination rules [please visit this link](https://www.eastc.ac.tz/index.php?r=site%2Fdoc)

EASTC's Data Science programs are designed to offer the students with an opportunity to learn new tools and techniques, how to apply them to solve real-world problems and make data-driven decisions. Our courses cover a wide range of topics in Data Science, including data mining, machine learning, predictive analytics, big data analytics, and much more. The Programme runs for 3 Years [please click here to apply](https://olap.eastc.ac.tz/site/login)
